title: Chemistry: Can frying unsaturated oils cause a small percent of the oils to be converted to their trans form? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don't think so. Hydrogenation happens on the molecular level. Heating a fat is normally just a phase change: from a solid to a liquid (like in shortening) or from a liquid to a runnier liquid (like vegetable oil when it gets glossy). Even if it burns, that's not the process necessary to add more hydrogen to the molecules to make them solid at room temperature.
